result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time shall be served consecutive to Waukesha County Case 14-CF-1342 and another other sentence and with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Probation shall be consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defndant shall not be present where controlled substances are illegally purchased, sold or consumed.
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim, Joel V.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  
Defendant shall notify all health care providers of addiction history and opiate use.
